An administrator has been asked to create a replica of the production organization. The requirement states that existing fields, page layouts, record types, objects, and data contained in the fields and objects need to be available in the replica organization.
How can the administrator meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A - metadata only. B - nonsense, C - nonsense, D - Correct - Full Sandbox copies data + metadata.

choices.A: Use the Match Production Licenses tool.
choices.C: Merge Production and the sandbox using a template.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers purchased Field Service Lightning licenses in production and wants to make these licenses available in an active development sandbox with the minimum development impact.
How should an administrator create these licenses in the sandbox?

discussion.content: The answer is A. because the sandbox is in active development , for minimum development impact refreshing of sandbox may not be the best option.

The Match Production Licenses tool allows an administrator to create licenses in a sandbox that match the licenses in production. This is the recommended method for creating licenses in a sandbox because it allows the administrator to create the licenses with minimal development impact.
=>The easiest way to match production and sandbox license counts is to refresh the sandbox. If refreshing your sandbox is not an option, consider using the Match Production Licenses tool.

Selected Answer: A
Why refresh the sandbox if there is an easier way available?

The answer is D. A cannot be the answer as it is the alternative if option D doesn't work.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers sells monthly service subscriptions and wants to ensure their Opportunity reports accurately represent the amount of money to be received each month.
Which solution should an administrator use to meet this requirement?

discussion.content: I believe it should be A - Revenue Schedules allows to input revenue per month in an opportunity.

comments.content: No, snapshot are used to track value in the past, in this case you need to know the value in the future, so Revenue Schedule is the answer

choices.A: Use product revenue schedules for each revenue period.
choices.C: Use Opportunity formula fields for each reporting period.
choices.B: Use Process Builder and Flow to create custom object records.

questions.question_text:
The inside Sales Manager at Universal Containers wants to be able to report on how long leads have a Lead Status of "Open" before the status changes to another value. Additionally, the sales team has requested the status value be changed with fewer clicks.
What should the administrator do to meet this requirement?

choices.A: Use a Workflow Rule that sends an email when the Lead Status is changed.
choices.B: Use a Quick Action to update a date field and change the status value.
choices.D: Use a formula field to calculate the date when the status changes.
choices.C: Turn on field history tracking for the lead status field and create a report based on that field.

discussion.content: I think it should be B
But B would not meet the requirement of being able to report on how long leads have a Lead Status of "Open" before the status changes to another value.

comments.content: meet if update a date field
